column4: So 8.04 uses Firefox 3.0b5, according to wikipedia.  Does that mean that 3.0b5 is not known to have any security flaws that are fixed in 3.6.10?
*Wikipedia.
ignore wikipedia.  its not 100% up-to-date
the LTS IS the latest release
Maverick isnt released yet
and the REASON we don't have the most up to date stuff is because of stability testing
Essentially what I'm trying to ask is: Do I upgrade to Maverick or maintain Lucid next month?
your choice, but the most recently released package versions are not going to be included immediately... they go through stability testing FIRST before the repositories are updated
i recommend staying with the LTS
I never upgrade anyways when something is first released.
i let it exist for a little while first, so that bugs are fixed, issues are addressed
besides...
bugfixes are applied in LTS and current builds
so having said that
updated repos are pushed in 10.04 and Maverick once its released
so yeah, enough discussion on whether to upgrade, we can continue that in #ubuntu+1
connect to the internet, run Synaptic, hit Reload, then Mark All Upgrades
or, in terminal:
sudo apt-get update; sudo apt-get upgrade
that updates all information about the repositories, and then applies any current package upgrades
that will nto upgrade you to the next release, but updates all  your packages.
See, Maverick snapshot has Firefox 3.6.10.  Lucid now has 3.6.10.  So what's the crucial difference?
between the firefox versions? none
the differences can be explained if you ask in #ubuntu+1
